data.title: A nice place for food and drinks
data.text: My friend and I have eaten here twice. We're had such dishes as the Caesar salad, the boursin burger, the stuffed banana peppers, the meatballs, and the calamari. All were good. Tonight we dined with a friend who was (unbeknownst to us) high-maintenance, and she didn't like much of anything; all I can say is: I ate her calamari, it was delicious, and I'm not sure her opinion can be trusted. As designated driver, I drank water, but my friends liked their drinks (two martinis and straight vodka each). Tonight's meal for three, including four alcoholic beverages and tax and generous tip, was $75. I thought the prices were reasonable and the food was good.

data.title: Try the Arancini!
data.text: Casual dining with a friendly casual atmosphere. Try any of their appetizers, especially the arancini and/or meatballs. Their pizzas are also a great choice!

data.title: Holy meatballs!
data.text: The meatballs are incredible! Sit on the patio on wine Wednesday, get a discounted bottle of wine, and an order of the meatballs! Mwwwah! 💋 What better way to enjoy friends or make new ones than sunset on the patio at V2! As a full blooded Italian, I don't eat sauce out. But I love their sauce on the meatballs with the dollop of ricotta cheese! Bellissimo!

data.title: Great place to eat and drink
data.text: I can't believe this place is so far down this list! As a frequent business traveler this is the type of upscale, great healthy food selection restaurant I wish I could find everywhere. Good wine selection, got a highly discounted bottle on wine night, and menu is packed with fresh, good foods on the light side. Should be ranked at the top of this list from what I saw in town.

data.title: Wanted to have fun turned into a nightmare
data.text: I had the worst experience of eating out I have ever had here!!! The waitress spilled 3 drunks on my step dad he was soaked and my mom's tennis shoes were soakwd... and she just wanted to give them a couple napkins and thought that was ok..  then our food and appetizer came out at the same time they drop our appetizer and my mom's food on the floor..  then brought out some more food and my mom's food wasn't even cooked all the way... so after I had to ask to talk toa manager and SHAWN the manager was the most rude unprofessional person I have ever spoken to in my life.. he spoke to us like we were scum.. he made rude comments to other people sitting around us... I would never go back if I knew SHAWN was working... this individual should not be working with the public!!!!

data.title: Great little place in downtown!!!
data.text: Food and service were excellent!!  Loved the pizza and salads!  Meatball appetizer is unbelievable and a must try!!

data.title: delishhhhhhh
data.text: MEATBALLS AND RICOTTA....OH MY Goodness...hint hint also Rise Pies in Boardman sells their meatballs and ricotta as well if you can't get downtown.  Their stuffed peppers are amazing. Pizza. etc.  Only complaint is I feel like the bar is right on top of the seating area.  and if there is a band very loud and crowded.... but it's so good it's worth the pain.

data.title: Easy to make a meal amount friends with appetizers!
data.text: Excellent Edamame Hummus!! A must try! Don't forget to sample the hot peppers in oil, the meatballs and sauce and a delicious calamari appetizer! Ask for a side of fig Jelly, and don't forget to enjoy a glass of wine or a martini! :) Nice evening out!

data.title: Great place
data.text:
Usually go here with clients, the place is very unassuming but very convenient. Had a 5 dollar burger today, fresh and hot, for 5 bucks you can't beat it. The beef is good quality. French fries very good fresh. 

Look they have a variety of quality food here the tables and chairs are nothing great but the bottom line is the food. 

Eat here good food, and I would come here anytime. They are very consistent with quality. 

Some things as any place is better than others but again eat here.

data.title: very nice atmosphere
data.text: Good place to go for an after work cocktail and light dinner. It is a bit noisy during the weekend evenings

data.title: Great Surprise
data.text: Walking distance from Powers Auditorium.  Great food, We had the delicious wood fired pizzas and the arancini.  They offer a compact but very nice wine list, craft beer list, great staff.

data.title: Stop in and get good food and Atmosphere
data.text: Downtown Youngstown is not a place I normally go but I had heard good things so I decided to try it.  The inside is clean and nice.  I was surprised by the number of people with children but there was a children's show going on in town. They were quite busy while we were there but they handled it well.  A good selection of wines and beer plus our pizza was very good. We had some calamari as an appetizer that done just right.  I have to go back though because I was looking at all the food other patrons had and it all looked delicious.

data.title: Great place to grab a bie
data.text: very nice place to eat. Italian food, not overly expensive . One of the newer establishments. But Vernon the owner is very well known Chef

data.title: Good place downtown
data.text: I went with quite a large group of people before a concert and they handled us very quickly. The food was very good with some different items on the menu.

data.title: Exciting place to try!
data.text:
food:  fresh and tasty
service:  excellent
atmosphere:  sports-bar like with televisions.  Loud and dark after sunset.  I asked for a candle for the table, but they didn't have one.  The plates/dishes are unique!
conversation: difficult
beer:  good selection

data.title: Great place for drinks before a hockey game.
data.text: Great atmosphere for pre gaming.  The pomegranate martini is awesome.  The pizza is delicious.  Parking can be a bit of an issue if large events at Covelli Center.  Try the side streets or the valet service.

data.title: Nice spot for hipsters
data.text:
My husband, sister-in-law, nieces and I visited this spot after a dance recital in downtown Youngstown on a Friday night.  It was abundantly clear to me that I was not "hip" enough to enjoy the scene.  The music was so loud, a pleasant conversation was impossible.  The under 30 crowd stood around the bar and seemingly enjoyed themselves.

The restaurant doesn't have mainstream soda/cola/pop.  They simply have "Cola" as a beverage option - presumably because the alcohol is the main reason to go there and "cola" is a sufficient mixer.

The waitress we had was adequate, but did not service our table as often as she should have for such a small venue.

The food, however, was delicious!  I had a "light crust" pizza.  It was very tasty and enough to share.  Everyone else in our party also enjoyed their food.

I don't think I'll be back, but I recommend it for someone who might better fit into the atmosphere.

data.title: Fun downtown experience.
data.text: My husband and I visited for the first time recently.  Our waiter was very friendly.  They have a nice beer and wine selection.  Wish they would add Red Bridge which is a gluten-free beer.  We both had burgers (three meats ground together).  They were delicious.  We also had the arancini....excellent!

data.title: ok happy hour place
data.text: I had one of the pizza's which was alright.  Catering to a hip urban (and older) crowd, which actually seems to exist in Youngastown.  Sorry about that, couldn't resist.  Portions are small.  Service staff was good, had a big crowd when I was there (musical event downtown).

data.title: Nicely done place on Federal Plaza
data.text:
This Italian place had great pizzas and good appetizers - we had the calamari and the stuffed banana peppers.  The funghi (mushroom) and Bianca (hot pepper) pizzas were very good, but the Margherita pizza was way too saucy (damp crust) and had too little cheese.
The atmosphere is upscale and modern, although sitting near the kitchen can get quite loud.  It is nice to see downtown Youngstown have something other than empty storefronts, and I hope and pray that this place starts a trend!
